result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Jose Bravo Morales

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Jose Bravo Morales in court.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Juan Jose Bravo Morales.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Spanish Interpreter Susan Rascon in court.
3:06 p.m.
Interpreter sworn in.
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Parties ready to proceed to Arraignment. 
Paper copy of Information has been reviewed by all parties - tracks Complaint.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
Requests STC.
Court schedules.
Interpreter confirms date and time work with her schedule.
Court confirms all bond conditions remain in place.
3:14 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:50 pm.

8:29 AM Defendant Juan Jose Bravo Morales in court.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Juan Jose Bravo Morales.  Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter, Susan Rascon, appears by ZOOM.
Court calls case.
Interpreter sworn in.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Lyon heard - has reviewed with deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Request prelim within time limits.
8:32 off record.
8:34 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms date and time work with her schedule.
8:36 AM
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Dean Appt - Atty Scott Lyon - repayment at $100 per month beginning 09-01-2022

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Defendant Juan Jose Bravo Morales in court. 
Court calls case.
Interpreter, Susan Rascon sworn in.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft heard - has contacted the PD, but they do not speak Spanish.
Atty Hansen is present and is heard.
1:46 off record.
1:46 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms the date/time work with her schedule.
1:46 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Jose Bravo Morales appeared by Zoom video, in custody. Susan Rascon present  by Zoom as interpreter for Defendant. 
Court calls case. 
Susan Rascon sworn in. 
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties with deft. 
Deft spks- has not contacted PD office. 
Court spks- deft to contact PD office to determine eligibility. 
ADA speaks on bond recommendation. 
Court imposes: $500.00 cash bond with conditions; sign waiver of extradition, contact public defenders office to determine if you qualify for representation within 24 hours of being released from jail, no possession or consumption of alcohol or any THC and no contact with Victim G.M.E. 
Court schedules with parties. 
Susan Rascon confirms. 
Deft is being heard. 
1:16 PM
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
